content: So the book is finally available online: https://rust-lang.github.io/unsafe-code-guidelines/

I've submitted a PR to update the readme a bit: https://github.com/rust-lang/unsafe-code-guidelines/pull/132
You can see the readme rendered here: https://github.com/gnzlbg/unsafe-code-guidelines/blob/readme_update/README.md
we should probably also not have the glossary as start page?
why is it used as start page anyway?
maybe that should be a copy of the README or so? not sure
the glossary is just set as the first chapter of the book, we can change that, but for now, at least things work

While a short introduction could come first, I believe that the current structure – the generalized glossary information before more-detailed subchapters – better educates first-time (or infrequent) readers on the issues. People who frequently use unsafe may not need this structure, but hopefully those people are rather rare.
